posts.title: Dog Star Man (1962-1964)
posts.excerpt: Quote:Finally reunited, Stan Brakhage’s masterpiece Dog Star Man is an experimental movie without sound. A creation myth realized in light, patterns, images superimposed, rapid cutting, and silence. A black screen, then streaks of light, then an explosion of color and squiggles and happenstance. Next, images of small circles emerge then of the Sun. Images of …

posts._title: Wojciech Smarzowski – Dom zly AKA The Dark House (2009)
posts.title: Dom zly
posts.excerpt: Quote:The story takes place in two parallel time planes. The first plot follows the events of one autumn night in 1978. Edward Srodon, a zootechnician, makes an accidental stopover in a farmhouse of Dziabas family in the remote area of Bieszczady Mountains. He stays for the night. The initial distrust between the guest and his …

posts.title: Genesung
posts.excerpt: Synopsis:‘The authorities expect the case of Friedel Walter, alias “Dr. Müller,” to be a straightforward one: he was working as a doctor without proper credentials under a false name. But Mehlin, the man in charge of his case, knows that there is more to the story. When he was injured fleeing from a concentration camp, …

posts._title: Riccardo Freda – L’iguana dalla lingua di fuoco AKA The Iguana with the Tongue of Fire (1971)
posts.title: L’iguana dalla lingua di fuoco
posts.excerpt: Synopsis:In Dublin, a young woman is brutally murdered in her home by a maniac that throws acid in her face and then slits her throat with a razor. Her mangled body is later discovered in the boot of a limousine owned by the Swiss Ambassador Sobiesky. The Ambassador, who was the dead woman’s lover, refuses …
posts.titleEnglish: The Iguana with the Tongue of Fire

posts._title: Luigi Zampa – Gente di rispetto aka The Flower In His Mouth aka The Masters (1975)
posts.title: Gente di rispetto
posts.excerpt: A female school teacher is implicated in a murder in a Sicilian town only hours after her arrival. The dead man insulted her on the bus on the way into town. As the mystery unfolds, it becomes clear that the town is hiding some very sinister secrets.
posts.titleEnglish: The Flower In His Mouth aka The Masters

posts._title: Carlos Saura – La madriguera AKA Honeycomb (1969)
posts.title: La madriguera
posts.excerpt: Synopsis:‘Teresa and Pedro have been married for five years and are settled in a routine, and a rather sterile home. He manages – and possibly owns – a factory, while she is a lady of leisure. The arrival of a collection of furniture from Teresa’s childhood family home triggers a nightmare and subsequent sleepwalking, followed …

posts._title: William Wauer – Der Tunnel AKA The Tunnel (1915)
posts.title: Der Tunnel
posts.excerpt: David Bordwell wrote: In 1913, the popular novelist Bernhard Kellermann published Der Tunnel. It’s not quite science-fiction, more a prophetic fiction or realist fantasy in the vein of Things to Come. The book became a best-seller and the basis of a 1915 film directed by William Wauer.

posts._title: Pier Paolo Pasolini – Comizi d’amore AKA Love Meetings (1964)
posts.title: Comizi d’amore
posts.excerpt: Quote:Pasolini doesn’t so much ‘meet’ with people of all regions of his country as interrogate them, trying to investigate the sexual mores of his time in a typical melding of politics and sex, of Marx and Freud. Although dated, it’s vital as a time capsule of 60’s Italy and as a man-on-the-streets pseudo-sociological examination of …

posts._title: Jaime de Armiñán – El nido AKA The Nest (1980) (HD)
posts.title: El nido
posts.excerpt: The Nest (Spanish: El Nido) is a 1980 Spanish drama film written and directed by Jaime de Armiñán, starring Héctor Alterio and Ana Torrent.The plot follows the emotionally intense relationship between an old widower and a precocious thirteen-year-old girl.
